roleset.name: attract, draw near, stimulating attraction

role.descr: thing attracted to, if separate from attractor

example.name: attract-v: with secondary attractor
example.text: A free market with a profit motive will attract each investor to the liquidity and risks he can tolerate.
example.arg: A free market with a profit motive
to the liquidity and risks he can tolerate

example.name: attraction-n: Args 1 & 2
example.text: The physics teacher demonstrated the attraction of iron filings to a magnet.

example.name: attraction-n: Arg0 and MNR
example.text: People wear perfume to enhance their sexual attraction.

example.name: attraction-n: Args 1, 2, and EXT
example.text: His deep attraction to dangerous thrills has gotten him into trouble on occasion.

example.name: attraction-n: Args 0, 1, 2 and TMP
example.text: The child's constant attraction of attention to himself began to annoy us.

example.name: ARG3 and ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: If elected , Soong will have a wealth of government resources with which to attract even more people to openly support him , and this could be the straw that breaks the KMT 's back .
example.arg: even more people to openly support him

example.name: attracted-j: attractor in obj position
example.text: [British Air]-2 was originally attracted *trace*-2 to the chance of obtaining a 15% stake in the company, but wasn't particularly happy with paying $750 million.
example.arg: to the chance of obtaining a 15% stake in the company

example.name: attracted-j
example.text: it seems strange when-1 I am physically attracted to men [*-1]?

example.name: attractive-j
example.text: Teacher salaries are very high , is that so ? If there comes a day when everyone will become a teacher [ by hook or by crook | sharpen their heads ] , = as popular as the civil servants of today , that will mean that teachers are really attractive .

example.name: attractive-j
example.text: It 's just so aggravating when-1 she is n't very attractive . I like that picture too

roleset.note: ATTRACT-V NOTES: Frames file for 'attract' based on financial subcorpus; adjectival 'attracted' based on BOLT-4,5; adjectival 'attractive' based on BOLT-6. Updated thanks to examples found by Kate. (from attract.01-v)
ATTRACTION-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry attract.01, OntoNotes grouping senses 1, 4,& 5; no mapping to VN. Framed by Claire. (from attraction.01-n)
ATTRACTIVE-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. (from attractive.01-j)
ATTRACTED-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from attracted.01-j)
arg2 not grammatical with adjectiv 'attracted'. (from attract.01-v) Use arg0 for 'attractive' entity. (from attractive.01-j)
